description: From Medieval Latin exculpātus, perfect passive participle of exculpō, from Latin ex culpa, from ex- (“out, from”) + culpa (“fault; blame”).

verbs.description: exculpate (third-person singular simple present exculpates, present participle exculpating, simple past and past participle exculpated)

entries.meaning: To clear of or to free from guilt; exonerate.
